definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Honestly, this is easier than I expected, though the frequency of archaic and rare words is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 老實說，異體字和生僻字出現的頻率比我的預期高。

sentences.english: The proportion of Variants in Shuiwen is high.
sentences.chinese: 異體字在水文中佔據很高的比例。

sentences.english: The form is unified and variants are reduced.
sentences.chinese: 字形上統一寫法，減少異體字。

sentences.english: Variants in the sense of philology mainly refer to characters capable of replacing each other or variants of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 作爲文字學意義上的異文，主要是指通假字和異體字。

sentences.english: There are many variant characters on the Stone Inscriptions of Weijin South and North Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 魏晉南北朝石刻文獻材料中存在大量異體字。

sentences.english: Simplified Chinese characters don't contain any variant forms of these characters.
sentences.chinese: 經過改革後的簡化字基本不再使用異體字。

definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
